result.execSummary:
The defendant Jimmy Andrew Clark was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct, a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jimmy Andrew Clark

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
1:16 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Agent Mike Pulice present in court.  Court goes over monies due.  Statement by Agent Pulice - defendant is on a wage assignment and will be paid very shortly.  Defendant is on a waiting list to complete the domestic abuse counseling.  (Off the record)  (Court reconvenes)  Court extends probation for one year.

Court adjourned at 1:21 p.m.

records.descr: Notice of court ordered financial obligations

records.addlTxt:
No Contact provision of bond has been cancelled.
43

4:12 p.m.  Defendant present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court recites agreement, defendant will plea to count 2 with no repeater with probation and will dismiss and read-in court 1.  DA concurs.  Atty Privat concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as domestic.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.

Defendant enters a plea of GUILTY.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty to count 2 and strikes the repeater.  Court orders count 1 be dismissed and read-in.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Privat.  Statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:  SWD, and places the defendant on probation for 12 months.

CONDITIONS:

Domestic Violence Assessment and any follow-up
No violent contact with the victim - Sharon Ebert
court costs
Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent

Court adjourned at 4:19 p.m.
from the victim requesting the No Contact Provision be cancelled

1:10 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant, will be getting an attorney, requests a public defender.  Court will set for Status Hearing on April 13, 2015 at 1:00 P.M.

Court adjourned at 1:11 p.m.

1:06 p.m.  Defendant present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by defendant has made contact with the Public Defender's office.  Court will set for status hearing on March 30, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:07 p.m.

No Contact with Sharon E.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant may go to the residence of the victim to obtain his/her personal property, but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.

No Contact with Sharon E.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant may go to the residence of the victim to obtain his/her personal property, but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.

1:00 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court via video from the Green Lake County jail and without counsel.  Lisa Vanden Branden for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count.  Court finds probable cause.  Court instructs the defendant of his right to an attorney.  Defendant enters a plea of NOT GUILTY.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $500.00 signature bond and conditions of:  No Contact with Sharon E.  Forms of no contact include: in person, in writing, by telephone, by e-mail, or by any other forms of electronic communication, or through a third party intending to circumvent the no contact provision.  Defendant may go to the residence of the victim to obtain his/her personal property, but only under the supervision of a law enforcement officer.  Court will set for Status Hearing on March 16, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:04 p.m.
